description:
Learn to use tools from the Bioconductor project to perform analysis of genomic data. This is the fifth course in the Genomic Big Data Specialization from Johns Hopkins University.

                                            Syllabus
                        Week OneThe class will cover how to install and use Bioconductor software. We will discuss common data structures, including ExpressionSets, SummarizedExperiment and GRanges used across several types of analyses.Week TwoIn this week we will learn how to represent and compute on biological sequences, both at the whole-genome level and at the level of millions of short reads.Week Three In this week we will cover Basic Data Types, ExpressionSet, biomaRt, and R S4.Week FourIn this week, we will cover Getting data in Bioconductor, Rsamtools, oligo, limma, and minfi
title: Bioconductor for Genomic Data Science
